alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 7:08PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Big Horn and east central Yellowstone Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 707 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Ballantine, or 20 miles northwest of Hardin, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pompeys Pillar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
